intro: Pilocarpus racemosus subsp. goudotianus, commonly known as the Brazilian pilocarp tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to parts of South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree characterized by its aromatic leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant is known for containing the alkaloid pilocarpine, which has various pharmacological applications. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
